channel.title: SevenAtSevenSection1
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenSection1, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: DNC chair says he's tired of Democrats bringing 'pencil to a knife fight'
item.description: Day 1 of the Democratic National Committee's summer meeting saw party chair Ken Martin detail how the party is pushing back on Trump administration po...

item.title: NEA cancels decades-long creative writing fellowship
item.description: For decades the program has supported writers who would become big names – Alice Walker, Michael Cunningham, Louise Erdrich and more. Last week, appli...

item.title: AI "deadbots" are persuasive — and researchers say, they're primed for monetization
item.description: The digital afterlife industry may near $80 billion in a decade, fueled by AI "deadbots." Tech firms see profit. But experts warn of troubling consequ...

item.title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are in their engagement era
item.description: The singer-songwriter announced the engagement Tuesday on Instagram, with the caption: "Your English teacher and your gym teacher are getting married....

item.title: Whistleblower says Trump officials copied millions of Social Security numbers
item.description: A whistleblower complaint says that the personal data of over 300 million Americans was copied to a private cloud account to allow access by members o...

item.title: Anthropic settles AI book-training lawsuit with authors
item.description: Called Bartz v. Anthropic, the case deals with Anthropic's use of books as training material for its large language models.

item.title: A Radiohead song from 1997 is on the Hot 100 charts, thanks to TikTok
item.description: "Let Down" broke into the Billboard Hot 100 nearly 30 years after its release, marking just the fourth Radiohead song to enter the charts.

item.title: Why the US government is not the savior Intel needs
item.description: Intel doesn't need cash. Instead, the struggling semiconductor giant needs to figure out how to drum up interest for its foundry business.

item.title: Anthropic launches a Claude AI agent that lives in Chrome
item.description: Anthropic is the latest AI lab to offer an AI agent with the ability to view and take action in a user's Chrome browser.

item.title: Libby’s library app adds an AI discovery feature, and not everyone is thrilled
item.description: Libby launches "Inspire Me," a genAI feature that helps its users find books to borrow from local libraries.

item.title: The New (Better) BRRRR Method: Less Risk, More Cash Flow
